metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8735 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Remote code execution is possible with Apache Tomcat before 6.0.48, 7.xbefore 7.0.73, 8.x before 8.0.39, 8.5.x before 8.5.7, and 9.x before9.0.0.M12 if JmxRemoteLifecycleListener is used and an attacker can reachJMX ports. The issue exists because this listener wasn't updated forconsistency with the CVE-2016-3427 Oracle patch that affected credentialtypes.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
tomcat7 - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
tomcat7-common - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
tomcat7-user - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tomcat6 package in trusty/esm is affected and needs fixing.
tomcat7 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8').
